edu.ucsb.cs56.projects.math.conversion_quiz

Class Quiz

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ucsb.cs56.projects.math.conversion_quiz.Quiz

  • public class Quiz
extends java.lang.Object
    A command line interface for a binary/octal/hex conversion Quiz. Original program by Erick Valle & George Barrios for Mantis 0000391 Edited by Andrew Berls for Mantis 0000611
    Version:
    CS56, Spring 2013
    Author:
    Daniel Ly

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Quiz(int numQuestions)
      Constructor initializes a fixed number of random questions

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getMode() 
      int getNumQuestions() 
      int getPercentage()
      Get the user's percentage of correct answers
      Question getQuestion(int idx) 
      java.lang.String getReadout()
      A readout showing the score percentage, e.g., "Your score was 67%!"
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getScores()
      Loads the scores from the save file into an ArrayList
      void insertScore(boolean correct)
      Insert a score into the list of user answers
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      main prompts the user for a number of questions and runs a new Quiz
      int numCorrect()
      Get the number of correct answers from the scores array True indicates correct, false for incorrect
      void resetScores()
      Resets the scores in the save file
      void run()
      Run the Quiz game on the command line For each question, display its prompt and track the user's answer At the end, display the percentage of correct answers.
      void setMode(int mode)
      Set the mode to a specific radix, e.g., 2, 8, 10, 16 in order to practice conversions to that radix
      void writeScore(int... scores)
      Saves multiple scores into the save file
